info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 5:59PM MST until July 15 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, central Cochise.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Fivemile Creek, Haberstock Wash, Indian Creek, Big Bend Creek, Slavin Wash, Dragoon Wash, Henderson Wash, West Whitetail Creek, Clifford Wash, Witch Creek, Keating Creek, Wood Canyon, Stanford Creek, Silver Creek, Ash Creek, East Whitetail Creek, Reeves Creek, O B Draw, East Turkey Creek, Leslie Creek, Big Sand Wash, Walnut Wash, Rucker Canyon, Pridham Creek, Turkey Creek, Pinery Creek, South Fork Keating Creek, Whitewater Draw, Gadwell Canyon, Willow Wash, San Simon River, Cave Creek, Walnut Gulch and Onion Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dragoon, Pearce-Sunsites, Chiricahua National Monument, Cochise, Elfrida, Sunizona, McNeal, Kansas Settlement, Rucker Canyon and Paradise. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING
